reviews.text: A charming old church left from the Spanish colonial old days. Not as impressive as the cathedrals left by the French in Hanoi or Ho Chi Minh City, but the historical value is right there before your eyes. This cathedral says as much about the old Spanish colonial days as the current Philippines. This country was a prosperous place in Asia in the '60s, but now it just feels it's missed the train of development. Best wishes to this lovely place and it's kind people.

When you want to go to church and pray its good. But you will have to endure mingling with a lot of churchgoers  mixed with tourists in this place  going in and out of the church. Due to its miraculous intercession a lot of devotees are always here to show their gratitude for help receive from the prayers granted.

This place is so wonderful, many people are here. The architecture of the Basilica is nice. If you want to light candles you can do it there for free. The environment is great and the feeling of being there is nostalgic. 
There's a mass every hour and 30 minutes for an interval.

Beautiful place of worship and very historical. The magellan's cross is found before the entrance to the church. Masses are scheduled in certain times and during mass times, church is always full. They have a small museum within the area and has entrance fees. Also a delicacy shop can be found before the entrance of the church. A lot of street vendors selling candles, pearls and snacks and water bottles before the entrance. Great place to attend mass and learn history altogether.

One of the oldest places to worship in Cebu Island. I really enjoyed the atmosphere of the place. It is solemn and I feel safe inside. The people there are not rowdy. The securities are nice people and will always give you a smile. 

But I have a cons for this place. It is not a good time to go during peak hours as it will get so crowded. So many people will come and go. And you will fight through it. Anyways the place is safe and there are food restaurants outside. Recommended for tourists if you like holy places.

The ambiance is pretty vintage. It's quite. Simple. Traditional. Brings the feelings to the past. Must visit. They have a small cafe after the tour around..they have some awesome sandwiches and amazing coffee.

This museum has very knowledgeable tour guides. I will definitely recommend this to schools and if possible, tell other institutions to include this museum in their itinerary when they have an educational tour. The tour guide, Rave ( ask for him if you go there ) was kind and ready to answer any question that we had for him. 

The house was able to tell a lot of stories of the Mestizos and the Filipino culture as influenced by the Spaniards, and even by the Chinese and Japanese with their Porcelain Chinaware with Geisha designs. 

We didn't get to visit the souvenir shop and cafe since it was already closed when we finished our tour so we are definitely going back there to try their frappe!

worth every peso that you pay. visited the place last Wednesday, March 27,2019 with a friend and we didn't expect to get that much information from our tour guide. :) I really commend our tour guide on that day..sadly we weren't able to get his name. He's very witty, detailed and patiently answers our questions. tour was very interactive! learned lots of things I honestly didn't hear from school. other than the beauty of the place, the thing that makes me wanna visit the place again is the nostalgia it gives me even if I haven't been born in the 1850s. everything was preserved really well and you'll get to learn their relevance in the society, culture, literature and so much more. I hope everyone gets to visit Casa Gorordo. :)
Great historical stop. One of the oldest houses in Cebu. Well preserved and includes interactive exhibits and a tour guide. Well worth a one hour stop.

It was a nice experience and the house is beautiful. Its like we were there during the time that house has been constructed and it is nice seeing a house that has been well preserved and the people there are nice even  our guide is good she explained everything thoroughly.

Once a prison hall, the museum boasts of various artifacts donated by various families here in Cebu. They give guided tours and the people there are friendly and accommodating. Come in groups and have some look and feel of old Cebu through the Museum's activities and clothes rental services. There's even watercolor painting in the souvenir shop!

Should have included this place for our guests touring Cebu, at least for those very interested about the history of the province. They have a good number of historical documents and some items before and after the second world war. The guides are fairly knowledgeable but very pleasing. It will take about an hour or two to go through all the rooms and the souvenir shop and cafeteria!

Didn't know this place had at least 4 galleries!!! A nice place to visit for some (limited) history of the province up to the Philippine presidents. We need better training for the intern guides though. Accuracy of historical information being shared must be checked at times.
If you get along good with the free guide it will be informative. 75 pesos as of March 2019
Very informative only that aircon wasn't turned on last Saturday knowing the place was was packed.

Lovers of pizza always comes to Alberto's who is always on the rescue. Prices are just right and with varieties of flavors to choose from. It actually has a lot of branches all over Cebu City so you can grab get a pizza from any of these branches. A must see and try!
I always love the place and the pizza since the day this branch here opens. Love the staff that serves who were all friendly and keeps the place tidy. The place is very accessible. Must try!

Great pizza for a barkadahan feast..
Love the hawaian varity👍😘

This isn't a review of a particular Alberto's but their brand in general. After having lived in the Philippines over a year, I finally broke down and ordered pizza delivery, having low expectations.
This is definitely not pizza. And I'm not really sure it's food. The cheese is processed. The tomato sauce is a watered down form of ketchup. The dough is really more sad sponge than bread. It's a made to order food product that's essentially totally processed. 
I feel sorry for the person who created this company. He must've never tasted truly authentic pizza before he started making these impostor pizzas. By far the worst pizza I've had anywhere in the country.
Cheap yet one of the best tastes pizza in town 😍🍕
One of the best LECHON in TOWN! The skin is so crispy but juicy in the inside. Will order again!
Very Yummy! The best lechon in Cebu i can say!
Small shop but the lechon was so juicy !!

This is very underrated but it is the BEST lechon i've tasted in Cebu. I lived in Cebu for 3 years and have tasted every possible lechon in the city there is (No, i have tried Talisay's). Their lechon has the right saltiness and the flavor is kinda addictive. It doesn't taste like CNT or Rico's, because it's unique. The price is just slightly cheaper than the more famous ones. I remember bringing my visiting brother here after eating at 3 lechon places... he's full.. and guess what? This is his favorite! I was a normal customer in the AS Fortuna Branch and I'm already missing it!

If you're looking for a delicious and authentic pizza in Cebu. This is the place! I highly recommend the Salmon Salad for a healthy starter and Gregorio pizza for the main course. Service is fast and staff are friendly.

It's a nice, uncrowded resto serving good Italian food with generous servings. Had a good early dinner with some friends and we had the place pretty much to ourselves. Service was quick and unobtrusive, though we had to ask for some utensils because they seem to have forgotten to provide us with some. Try the focaccia and aglio olio, which were my favorites.
Love their wood firez pizza :)
Place is not crowded and food is the best

Giuseppe Pizzeria & Sicilian Roast
The food is tasty delicious
God selection of wines, tea and coffee 
Smoking area outside with fan
Aircon inside with Free wifi
Looks at customers to see if any of them need something
Opens and greets the customer
Fast, efficient and overall quality service 
Can I please give them six stars
Best lechon manok I ever tasted!
The lechon manok and the sauce really matches. It's very delicious.
Yummy chicken here. I love it! 😘
Delicious chicken. Expect struggle in ordering due to high demand.
The chicken is highly recommended but the customer service was slightly disappointing.

I love the smell and the sight. I've been a fan of this place since many years ago. And still is. The only thing i don't like about this place is, they/sellers compete when you enter so you don't get a chance to look around and choose the best offering for the night. So the best way to enjoy what the place offers is to prepare to refuse their initial offers and look around and choose the best goods for your meal.

Fast service and value for money.
No longer smoky eating area.
The best place for the budget conscious but wants a wide variety of food and good tasting food.

Avoid going to the SUITE 16 BBQ STATION in here. They did a bait and switch on us with the seafood. The crab that we selected was definitely not the same one that came back to us. The one that came back had no meat in it except for the claws (and a different sex - yes, I was paying attention).

Also, they charged us extra for a "cooking fee."
I've been in this place even before it was renovated. A lot of choices of food  are available here. This is suitable for barkada or group eating.
Food is delicious.. But longer waiting time for the barbecue. Table is wet..
Kicked off our late lunch with spicy squid salad. Followed by sweet-spicy pad thai and smoked pork banh mi... Hmmmm

One of my family's go to places. Always order the roti, beancurd claypot and the fish. Food is always fresh and tasty. There may be a line especially during the peak hours so better come early. Sometimes we just order while waiting so when our food so when our table is ready, we're all set!

Second time here and this time, i so love their food. Delicious! Roti curry dip tastes good. I love how the oyster sauce with a bit of spiciness mixed the moment it reaches your palate, with their oyster squid. The squid was also tender and u'll enjoy it to the last piece. Their brocolli seafood was also great.

When you look at their menu, it may look expensive but their serving is for sharing already of about 2-3 persons.

The food was served at a reasonable time. Their staffs are quick however not that friendly. Prolly because that was give or take 8pm, nearing the end of their day and most likely tired already. 

But can't discount the fact that their food is sumptous and I recommend dining there.

Service is great! Orders come in large servings, better for family eats than dates. 
They let me reserve a table and order ahead. Very friendly staff :)
The food could be better. Love the hot prawn salad and spice fusion noodles. Though the Singaporean chicken in terms of appearance and taste is very similar to lechon manok.
Friendly service and the food was good.
Great place to dine and wind. Roti's is one my favorite dish a must try. Just like dinning in a great hospitable home.

It has a wide variety of desserts for all of your sweet cravings. Their desserts have unique textures and flavors that hop from chocolatey to fruity, from soft to crunchy. It also has savory dishes and appetizers. And above all, it offers all-day breakfast that comes with servings that are huge and filling. It provides WiFi connectivity but the signal is slow. Although the waiters are kind and very responsive to questions, the service time needs to improve. How the place is decorated looks off, too, does not immediately give you the impression that this is a place for desserts. Also, the laminated printed menu it provides to customers looks hastily done, its layout incredibly confusing. Finally, the last time we went there, the restroom was closed for fixing.
Nice mango crepe in creme brulee style!
Always love the carrot cake😍😍
My girlfriend and I once had a stomachache the night before a marathon after having their sweet and sour fish. I still keep coming back for it but not before a big race. It's that good.

One of the few sit down restaurants in the Ayala mall area that is open for breakfast. 

In addition to desserts, they have a full menu of western and Filipino choices.  Prices are very good for the mall location.
